comments.body: Technically we can remove these since they should be baselined in the server log. Thoughts?

Personally, I think it's better to just use the baseline because updating this would be tedious.  However, I agree that it's hard to figure out which parts of the baseline a particular test cares about, so I find it helpful to document my expectations in the test so that someone bulk updating baselines has some chance of figuring out if they broke something.
Looking back at the code, I think I'll keep it in because I have to check the language service directly anyway - not just the server.
If there isn't already such a test, it would be nice to confirm that something sensible happens for semantic and suggestion diagnostics.

The [test above (`throws on unsupported commands`)](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/blob/09af37b0bba5dfdd5f64de865fa8092067125e93/src/testRunner/unittests/tsserver/partialSemanticServer.ts#L82-L112) should have a `SemanticDiagnosticsSync` request.
Its already in describe block for with `unittests:: tsserver:: Semantic operations on PartialSemantic server`
Ah, missed what file this was.
